title: Acts Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 4.

questions.question: Who came upon Peter and John as they spoke to the people?
options: The priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees
The Pharisees and scribes
The Roman soldiers
The disciples
questions.correctAnswer: The priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees
questions.explanation: Acts 4:1 states that the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them as they spoke to the people.

questions.question: Why were the priests and Sadducees grieved according to Acts 4?
options: Because Peter and John taught the resurrection through Jesus
Because they were preaching against the law
Because they refused to pay taxes
Because they healed the sick in secret
questions.correctAnswer: Because Peter and John taught the resurrection through Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 4:2 explains that the priests and Sadducees were grieved because Peter and John taught the people and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

questions.question: How many men believed after hearing the word?
options: About five thousand
About one thousand
About ten thousand
About two hundred
questions.correctAnswer: About five thousand
questions.explanation: Acts 4:4 states that many who heard the word believed, and the number of men was about five thousand.

questions.question: Who were gathered together at Jerusalem on the morrow?
options: Rulers, elders, scribes, Annas, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and kindred of the high priest
Only the apostles
Roman centurions
The Pharisees only
questions.correctAnswer: Rulers, elders, scribes, Annas, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and kindred of the high priest
questions.explanation: Acts 4:5-6 describes that rulers, elders, scribes, Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest were gathered at Jerusalem.

questions.question: What question did the rulers and elders ask Peter and John?
options: By what power or name have you done this?
Where did you learn to heal?
Who gave you permission to speak?
Why do you gather people?
questions.correctAnswer: By what power or name have you done this?
questions.explanation: Acts 4:7 states that they asked Peter and John by what power or by what name they had done the healing.

questions.question: Who was filled with the Holy Ghost and spoke to the rulers and elders?
options: Peter
John
Annas
Caiaphas
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: Acts 4:8 says that Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, spoke to the rulers and elders of Israel.

questions.question: By what name did Peter say the impotent man was healed?
options: Jesus Christ of Nazareth
Moses
Elijah
John the Baptist
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ of Nazareth
questions.explanation: Acts 4:10 states that the man was made whole by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth.

questions.question: What did Peter call Jesus in Acts 4:11?
options: The stone which the builders rejected
The Son of David
The prophet from Galilee
The King of the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: The stone which the builders rejected
questions.explanation: Acts 4:11 describes Jesus as the stone which was set at nought by the builders but has become the head of the corner.

questions.question: According to Acts 4:12, where is salvation to be found?
options: In no other name than Jesus
In the law of Moses
In the temple sacrifices
In the wisdom of the elders
questions.correctAnswer: In no other name than Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 4:12 clearly states that there is no salvation in any other name under heaven given among men but by Jesus.

questions.question: How did the rulers and elders react to the boldness of Peter and John?
options: They marveled and perceived that they had been with Jesus
They immediately arrested them again
They praised their knowledge
They ignored them
questions.correctAnswer: They marveled and perceived that they had been with Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 4:13 says the rulers marveled at their boldness and perceived that they had been with Jesus despite being unlearned and ignorant.

questions.question: True or False: The healed man was over forty years old according to Acts 4.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 4:22 states that the man who was healed was above forty years old.

questions.question: True or False: The council allowed Peter and John to continue preaching freely without any threats.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 4:17-18 shows that the council threatened Peter and John to stop speaking in the name of Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: Peter and John obeyed the council and stopped speaking about Jesus.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 4:19-20 shows that Peter and John said they must speak what they have seen and heard, refusing to obey the council over God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: After being released, Peter and John went to their own company and reported all that the ______ and elders had said unto them.
options: chief priests
scribes
apostles
Romans
questions.correctAnswer: chief priests
questions.explanation: Acts 4:23 states that Peter and John reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.

questions.question: What happened after the believers prayed together in Acts 4:31?
options: The place was shaken, they were filled with the Holy Ghost, and spoke the word of God with boldness
They were arrested again
They went to the temple to sacrifice
They scattered and hid
questions.correctAnswer: The place was shaken, they were filled with the Holy Ghost, and spoke the word of God with boldness
questions.explanation: Acts 4:31 describes that after prayer, the place shook, they were filled with the Holy Ghost, and spoke boldly.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Acts 4 teach us about boldness in sharing the Gospel, especially when facing opposition?
options: By praying for boldness and speaking the word of God fearlessly
By avoiding confrontation and staying silent
By using clever arguments to win debates
By relying solely on personal wisdom and strength
questions.correctAnswer: By praying for boldness and speaking the word of God fearlessly
questions.explanation: Acts 4:29-31 shows the believers praying for boldness to speak God's word despite threats, and they were filled with the Holy Ghost and spoke with boldness.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear after witnessing hostility for their faith. Based on Acts 4, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in trials?
options: God is sovereign and His hand accomplishes His purpose, so we can be bold
We should hide our faith to avoid trouble
We must rely on our own strength to endure
God only protects those who are perfect
questions.correctAnswer: God is sovereign and His hand accomplishes His purpose, so we can be bold
questions.explanation: Acts 4:27-28 explains that God’s hand and counsel determined what happened, encouraging believers to trust His sovereignty in trials.

questions.question: How does Acts 4 encourage believers to respond when authorities command them not to speak in Jesus' name?
options: Obey God rather than men and continue to speak what they have seen and heard
Comply with the authorities to avoid punishment
Remain silent and pray privately only
Negotiate with the authorities for permission
questions.correctAnswer: Obey God rather than men and continue to speak what they have seen and heard
questions.explanation: Acts 4:19-20 records Peter and John saying they must obey God rather than men and cannot stop speaking about what they have witnessed.

questions.question: What does Acts 4 teach about the importance of unity and sharing within the Christian community?
options: Believers should be of one heart and share possessions to meet each other's needs
Each believer should keep their possessions private
Wealth should be used only for personal gain
Sharing is optional and not required
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should be of one heart and share possessions to meet each other's needs
questions.explanation: Acts 4:32-35 describes believers having all things in common and distributing resources according to need, showing unity and generosity.

questions.question: How does the example of Barnabas in Acts 4 teach us about generosity and stewardship?
options: He sold land and gave the proceeds to the apostles to help the community
He kept his possessions for himself
He gave a small portion reluctantly
He asked others to donate instead
questions.correctAnswer: He sold land and gave the proceeds to the apostles to help the community
questions.explanation: Acts 4:36-37 shows Barnabas selling his land and laying the money at the apostles’ feet, demonstrating sacrificial giving for the good of others.

questions.question: According to Acts 4, how should believers respond when they see God performing signs and wonders through them?
options: Give glory to God and continue witnessing boldly
Take credit for the miracles themselves
Hide the miracles to avoid attention
Doubt the source of the miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Give glory to God and continue witnessing boldly
questions.explanation: Acts 4:21 and 4:33 show that people glorified God for the miracles, and the apostles gave witness with great power to the resurrection of Jesus.

questions.question: How does Acts 4 illustrate the role of prayer in facing persecution and challenges in the church?
options: Believers prayed together for boldness and God responded with power
They ignored prayer and relied on human plans
They prayed separately and silently only
They stopped praying due to fear
questions.correctAnswer: Believers prayed together for boldness and God responded with power
questions.explanation: Acts 4:24-31 records believers praying in unity for courage, after which the place shook and they were filled with the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: Acts 4 teaches that believers should hide their faith when threatened by authorities.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 4:18-20 shows that Peter and John were commanded not to speak, yet they refused to obey and boldly continued to proclaim Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: The healing of the impotent man in Acts 4 led many to believe, demonstrating the power of testimony and miracles in evangelism.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 4:4 states that many who heard the word believed, highlighting how miracles and testimony lead to faith.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to handle threats while witnessing. Based on Acts 4, what is the biblical response to threats against sharing the Gospel?
options: Pray for boldness and continue speaking God’s word
Stop witnessing to avoid trouble
Argue aggressively with opponents
Withdraw from fellowship
questions.correctAnswer: Pray for boldness and continue speaking God’s word
questions.explanation: Acts 4:29-31 shows believers praying for courage and being empowered by the Holy Spirit to speak boldly despite threats.

questions.question: How does Acts 4 encourage believers to live with contentment and generosity?
options: By sharing all possessions and ensuring no one lacks
By accumulating wealth for personal comfort
By competing for resources within the church
By keeping possessions secret
questions.correctAnswer: By sharing all possessions and ensuring no one lacks
questions.explanation: Acts 4:34-35 explains that those who had land or houses sold them to provide for others so that no one lacked anything.

questions.question: How does Peter's defense before the council in Acts 4 teach about the source of Christian authority and power for ministry?
options: Christian authority comes through the name of Jesus Christ raised from the dead
It depends on human education and position
It is based on personal charisma
It is inherited from religious leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Christian authority comes through the name of Jesus Christ raised from the dead
questions.explanation: Acts 4:10-12 shows Peter declaring the healing was done by Jesus Christ of Nazareth, emphasizing salvation and power in His name alone.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because they feel uneducated and unqualified for ministry. Based on Acts 4, what encouragement can be found about God using ordinary people?
options: God uses even unlearned and ignorant men who have been with Jesus to do great works
Only educated leaders can serve effectively
Ministry requires formal theological training
God only uses the wealthy for ministry
questions.correctAnswer: God uses even unlearned and ignorant men who have been with Jesus to do great works
questions.explanation: Acts 4:13 notes that the council marveled at Peter and John’s boldness despite them being unlearned, recognizing they had been with Jesus.

questions.question: In Acts 4, what biblical virtue is demonstrated by the early church's practice of sharing possessions and caring for one another?
options: Generosity and stewardship
Selfishness and independence
Pride and competition
Neglect and apathy
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity and stewardship
questions.explanation: Acts 4:32-35 describes the believers having all things in common and distributing resources according to need, exemplifying generosity and stewardship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Acts 4 teaches that when believers pray together with one accord, God responds by ______ them with the Holy Ghost.
options: filling
ignoring
punishing
warning
questions.correctAnswer: filling
questions.explanation: Acts 4:31 states that after praying together, the believers were filled with the Holy Ghost, empowering them to speak boldly.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 4.

questions.question: In Acts 4, who were the main Jewish authorities that confronted Peter and John after the healing of the impotent man?
options: Annas the high priest and Caiaphas
Pharisees and Essenes
Zealot leaders
Roman governors
questions.correctAnswer: Annas the high priest and Caiaphas
questions.explanation: Acts 4:6 specifically names Annas the high priest and Caiaphas among the rulers and elders who gathered to question Peter and John.

questions.question: Peter’s boldness in Acts 4 is attributed to being filled with what?
options: The Holy Ghost
Faith in the law
Anger against the Sadducees
Knowledge of the scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Acts 4:8 states that Peter was filled with the Holy Ghost when speaking to the rulers and elders.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure is indirectly referenced in the prayer of the believers for the opposition they faced, as quoted in Acts 4?
options: David
Moses
Elijah
Isaiah
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Acts 4:25 quotes from the Psalms, traditionally attributed to David, in the prayer referencing the rage of the heathen and opposition against God’s anointed.

questions.question: What is the significance of the stone mentioned in Acts 4:11 as 'the head of the corner' in biblical typology?
options: It symbolizes Jesus as the foundation of the Church
It refers to the temple cornerstone laid by Solomon
It is a metaphor for the Law of Moses
It represents the Roman government’s authority
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes Jesus as the foundation of the Church
questions.explanation: Acts 4:11 uses the metaphor of the stone rejected by builders becoming the cornerstone, a typology that alludes to Jesus as the foundation of the new covenant community.

questions.question: How many men are recorded as believers after Peter and John’s teaching in Acts 4?
options: About five thousand
Three thousand
One thousand
Ten thousand
questions.correctAnswer: About five thousand
questions.explanation: Acts 4:4 states that the number of men who believed after hearing the word was about five thousand.

questions.question: What was the council's main concern about Peter and John's preaching in Acts 4?
options: That the message would spread further among the people
That they would perform more miracles
That the apostles would overthrow the Roman government
That they would rebuild the temple
questions.correctAnswer: That the message would spread further among the people
questions.explanation: Acts 4:17 shows the leaders deciding to threaten Peter and John to prevent the spread of their teaching in Jesus’ name.

questions.question: How did Peter and John respond when commanded not to speak or teach in the name of Jesus?
options: They said they must obey God rather than men
They remained silent
They fled Jerusalem
They apologized and stopped preaching
questions.correctAnswer: They said they must obey God rather than men
questions.explanation: Acts 4:19 records Peter and John's response that it is right to obey God over human authorities.

questions.question: The communal sharing of possessions described in Acts 4 reflects which Old Testament concept?
options: The Jubilee Year where land was returned
The Levitical tithes
The prophetic demand for social justice
The Mosaic purity laws
questions.correctAnswer: The Jubilee Year where land was returned
questions.explanation: Acts 4:32-35 describes believers sharing possessions so no one lacked, reflecting the Jubilee’s emphasis on economic restoration and community care.

questions.question: The healing of the man over forty years old in Acts 4 is significant because:
options: It demonstrates the power of Jesus' name over long-term infirmity
It fulfilled a prophecy from Isaiah
It was a gesture for the Sadducees only
It occurred during the Passover festival
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates the power of Jesus' name over long-term infirmity
questions.explanation: Acts 4:22 notes the man was over forty years old, emphasizing the miraculous healing through Jesus’ name transcending lifelong disability.

questions.question: Which phrase in Acts 4:12 underscores the exclusivity of salvation through Jesus Christ and echoes the Shema of Deuteronomy?
options: "Neither is there salvation in any other"
"Hear, O Israel, the Lord is our God"
"The stone which the builders rejected"
"The kings of the earth stood up"
questions.correctAnswer: "Neither is there salvation in any other"
questions.explanation: Acts 4:12 stresses that salvation is found only through Jesus, echoing the monotheistic exclusivity emphasized in the Shema (Deut. 6:4).

questions.question: The prayer in Acts 4:29-30 requests boldness and what else as signs of divine approval?
options: Healing and wonders by the name of Jesus
Prosperity and peace
Victory over Roman soldiers
A new temple built in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Healing and wonders by the name of Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 4:29-30 prays for boldness to speak and for signs and wonders to be done through Jesus’ name as confirmation of God’s power.

questions.question: What is the Greek meaning of Barnabas, the surname given to Joses in Acts 4:36?
options: Son of consolation
Man of war
Teacher of the law
Gift of God
questions.correctAnswer: Son of consolation
questions.explanation: Acts 4:36 explains that Barnabas means 'son of consolation' in Greek, highlighting his role in encouraging the early church.

questions.question: How does the shaking of the place after the believers’ prayer in Acts 4:31 function as a literary device?
options: It symbolizes God's immediate presence and power
It represents an earthquake that destroyed the temple
It foreshadows the coming destruction of Jerusalem
It indicates a natural disaster unrelated to the prayer
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's immediate presence and power
questions.explanation: Acts 4:31 describes the place shaking after prayer, symbolizing divine approval and the empowerment of the believers by the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: The Sadducees were pleased that Peter and John preached about Jesus’ resurrection.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 4:2 states that the Sadducees were grieved because Peter and John preached Jesus’ resurrection, indicating their opposition.

questions.question: What historical or cultural significance does the gathering of the rulers, elders, and scribes in Acts 4:5-6 hold in the context of Jewish governance?
options: It represents the Sanhedrin assembling to judge religious matters
It was a Roman military tribunal
It was a gathering of Pharisaic rabbis only
It was a Gentile council convened in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It represents the Sanhedrin assembling to judge religious matters
questions.explanation: Acts 4:5-6 describes a gathering of Jewish leaders including high priests and elders, characteristic of the Sanhedrin, the Jewish ruling council responsible for religious and legal decisions.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who were grieved because Peter and John taught about Jesus' resurrection from the dead?
options: The priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees
The Pharisees and scribes
The apostles and elders
The Gentiles and Samaritans
questions.correctAnswer: The priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees
questions.explanation: Acts 4:1-2 states that the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees were grieved that Peter and John taught about Jesus' resurrection. This reflects opposition to the message of resurrection also seen in Acts 5:17 and John 11:47.

questions.question: What miracle is Peter defending when questioned by the rulers and elders?
options: Healing of a man impotent from birth
Raising a man from the dead
Feeding of five thousand
Walking on water
questions.correctAnswer: Healing of a man impotent from birth
questions.explanation: Acts 4:9-10 refers to the healing of the impotent man, which Peter defends as done by the name of Jesus Christ. This miracle confirms Jesus' power, paralleling miracles in Matthew 9:1-8 and John 5:1-9.

questions.question: According to Peter, in whose name is salvation found?
options: Jesus Christ of Nazareth
Moses
David
John the Baptist
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ of Nazareth
questions.explanation: Acts 4:12 states that salvation is found in no other name but Jesus Christ of Nazareth. This is consistent with John 14:6 and Isaiah 43:11, affirming the exclusivity of Christ for salvation.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the rulers when they saw Peter and John’s boldness despite their lack of formal education?
options: They marveled and recognized they had been with Jesus
They immediately arrested them again
They dismissed their testimony as ignorance
They praised their wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: They marveled and recognized they had been with Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 4:13 shows the rulers marveling at Peter and John’s boldness and perceived that they had been with Jesus, indicating the transformative work of Christ in believers, consistent with 2 Corinthians 12:9 and Ephesians 3:7.

questions.question: What was the council’s primary concern about the miracle performed by Peter and John?
options: That its fame would spread further among the people
That they would gain political power
That they were breaking temple laws
That they would perform more miracles
questions.correctAnswer: That its fame would spread further among the people
questions.explanation: Acts 4:16-17 reveals the council’s concern that the miracle and teaching would spread among the people, showing the fear of the gospel’s influence, as also seen in Acts 5:28 and Jeremiah 20:9.

questions.question: How did Peter and John respond to the command not to speak or teach in Jesus’ name?
options: They said they must obey God rather than men
They agreed to stop preaching
They fled the city
They appealed to the Roman authorities
questions.correctAnswer: They said they must obey God rather than men
questions.explanation: Acts 4:19-20 shows Peter and John affirming their duty to obey God rather than human authorities, reflecting Acts 5:29 and Daniel 3:17-18’s principle of divine obedience over human commands.

questions.question: What was the council’s final action after threatening Peter and John?
options: They released them because they could not punish them due to the people's support
They imprisoned them indefinitely
They sent them to Herod
They placed a guard on them
questions.correctAnswer: They released them because they could not punish them due to the people's support
questions.explanation: Acts 4:21 states the council let them go because they found no way to punish them since the people glorified God for the miracle, consistent with the power of public witness seen in Exodus 14:31 and Luke 4:28-30.

questions.question: What characteristic of the healed man is mentioned to emphasize the miracle's significance?
options: He was over forty years old
He was a known sinner
He was a priest
He was a Roman citizen
questions.correctAnswer: He was over forty years old
questions.explanation: Acts 4:22 notes the man was above forty years old, highlighting the enduring nature of his condition and the miracle's undeniable impact, paralleling emphasis in Luke 18:35 and John 9:1-7.

questions.question: What was the believers' response after Peter and John were released?
options: They prayed together for boldness and signs
They hid from the authorities
They dispersed to different cities
They protested in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: They prayed together for boldness and signs
questions.explanation: Acts 4:23-30 describes the believers praying for boldness and miraculous confirmation, reflecting reliance on God’s power as in Psalm 2 and Habakkuk 3:2, emphasizing dependence on the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What happened to the place where the believers prayed after Peter and John’s release?
options: It was shaken and they were filled with the Holy Ghost
It was destroyed by an earthquake
It was surrounded by soldiers
Nothing unusual occurred
questions.correctAnswer: It was shaken and they were filled with the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Acts 4:31 records the place shaking and the believers being filled with the Holy Spirit, empowering bold witness, consistent with Pentecost in Acts 2:2-4 and Joel 2:28-29.

questions.question: How were the early believers characterized in their communal life?
options: They had all things in common and shared possessions
They lived separately and kept possessions private
They avoided owning land or houses
They distributed wealth only to the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: They had all things in common and shared possessions
questions.explanation: Acts 4:32-35 describes a community unified in heart and soul, sharing possessions freely, exemplifying early Christian unity and generosity as in 2 Corinthians 8:13-15 and Hebrews 13:16.

questions.question: Who was Barnabas, and what did he do as an example of generosity?
options: A Levite from Cyprus who sold land and gave the money to the apostles
A Pharisee who opposed the apostles
A Roman official who converted to Christianity
A scribe who recorded the apostles’ teachings
questions.correctAnswer: A Levite from Cyprus who sold land and gave the money to the apostles
questions.explanation: Acts 4:36-37 identifies Barnabas as a Levite from Cyprus who sold land and gave the proceeds to the apostles, modeling sacrificial giving consistent with 2 Corinthians 9:6-7 and Luke 21:1-4.

questions.question: What Old Testament figure is quoted in the believers’ prayer to emphasize God’s sovereignty over earthly opposition?
options: David
Moses
Isaiah
Elijah
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Acts 4:25-26 cites David’s words about the nations raging, showing God’s sovereign control over opposition, aligning with Psalm 2 and Isaiah 8:10 regarding God's ultimate authority.

questions.question: According to Acts 4, what role did Herod, Pontius Pilate, Gentiles, and Israel play in Jesus’ death?
options: They were gathered to do what God’s hand and counsel had determined
They acted independently outside of God’s plan
They opposed God’s will and thwarted salvation
They were unaware of Jesus’ identity
questions.correctAnswer: They were gathered to do what God’s hand and counsel had determined
questions.explanation: Acts 4:27-28 affirms that the rulers and peoples acted according to God's sovereign plan, consistent with Isaiah 53:10 and Romans 8:28 emphasizing divine providence even through human actions.

questions.question: What did the apostles request from God in their prayer following their release?
options: Boldness to speak God’s word and the working of signs and wonders
Wealth and political power
Protection from persecution only
A sign to convert the rulers immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Boldness to speak God’s word and the working of signs and wonders
questions.explanation: Acts 4:29-30 shows the apostles praying for boldness and miraculous confirmation of their message, reflecting Jesus' promise in Mark 16:17-20 and the empowerment by the Holy Spirit in Acts 1:8.
